inn1.comm: full at off stump, driven firmly to mid-on
gets forward into a full delivery at middle and off, pushed just the left of mid-off and he can't get a single
touch shorter in length, 84mph, Roy moves onto off stump and defends to cover
walks into a solid defensive push and finds mid-off
finds space this time, just a hint of width outside off and Roy waits for it to come slowly off the surface then square drives between point and cover
good response from Irfan, short of a length, grips on the surface and is defended a little awkwardly into the off side and he steals a single towards mid-off
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
lovely piece of timing, a short-arm punch with a straight bat in front of square as he flicks away a length delivery from around off stump
full outside off, 79mph/127kph, chopped into the off side
flicks this from outside off into the leg side but midwicket cuts it off
movement back into Roy - bowlers often try to exploit the gap between bat and pad - and this is well bowled by Anwar as he keeps it full
a touch slower, 72mph, and Roy is nearly early on his drive as he comes forward but manages to stop himself spooning it towards mid-off
short of a length, Hales defends his first delivery to the off side
gets a thick edge wide of second slip, wasn't a chance, as Hales drove with hard hands at a full delivery angled across him and it runs to third man
on middle and off, 85mph/137kph, defended to the covers
pushed across shorter and wider outside off, Roy chases it and doesn't make contact
beaten again! This is a good delivery, angled across full outside off, Roy is feeling for it away from his body
drives square to backward point
full at off stump, offering to come back into Hales, someone else whose technique to the ball angling into him has been tested, defended back to the bowler
onto the front foot and pushed back down the pitch
this one keeps a fraction low, a straight delivery, flicked into the leg side
a little fuller this time, keeps it on the stumps, driven towards mid-on where Wahab can't stop it cleanly and gives away an extra run
full outside off, 69mph/112kph, and driven back to the bowler without much timing
a good-looking on-drive from Hales but he can't beat mid-on who gets across
cracked away! Dropped in short by Irfan, plenty of time to pick the length off a slow pitch and Hales pulls it firmly in front of square
adjusts his line and length, fuller outside off, driven to backward point
excellent delivery, nearly gets a yorker underneath Hales' bat but he's able to dig it out to midwicket
slash and a miss at a delivery pushed wider outside off, dies off the surface through to Sarfraz
works a straight delivery back to the bowler
drives at a full delivery, goes in the air backward of point down to third man
back of a length at off stump, punched to cover
opens his stance a touch to try and open the off side but can only pick out cover again
comes down the pitch, he's itching to get after Anwar, then swings a length delivery over the leg side and falls well in front of the man running around from deep square
that's a lovely from Roy, a wonderful clean strike as he uses his feet to shuffle down at Anwar then dispatches a full delivery clean over mid-on...elegant
loses his shape this time, coming down the pitch again and aims a hoick through the leg side but gets beaten...ball goes between leg stump and the batsman
short of a length outside off, sweetly timed off the back foot but finds cover
short on leg stump, Hales gets inside the line and flicks to long leg
full at leg stump this time, flicked off his pads
flips a length delivery into midwicket
opens the face and runs a delivery outside off down to third man
gets beaten under the bottom edge as he tries to square cut a delivery
a beauty! A terrific delivery, full on off stump, a cutter from Irfan which may have gripped a touch and beats Roy's outside edge
worked into the leg side
pushed to the covers
well, well...he's brought out the reverse sweep (or club, in fact a switch hit) as he takes this from outside leg stump and lofts it over point
comes down the pitch then pads into the off side
onto the back foot and pushed to the covers
slips down the leg side and called a wide
pushed back to the bowler
close! Drives firmly and edges a full delivery just wide of the lone slip down to third man
full at middle, defended back down the pitch
driven into the off side and beats a diving cover
comes forward and defends to backward point, another fumble in the field allows a single...Pakistan not as sharp so far today. Actually, the fielder beaten by the spin there
tight on middle and off, defended to the leg side...that one registered at 91mph
shorter in length, no width for Hales to work with, played into the covers
uses his feet, chips the delivery over the in-field and it lands short of deep midwicket
this is a more controlled version of the stroke, staying in his crease and flicks it along the ground wide of mid-on
full and whipped to mid-on
goes for the sweep, gets it towards short fine leg where Irfan basically falls over attempting to reach the ball
driven to the off side
that's a delightful way to bring up the fifty as Hales eases into the front foot drives through the covers...no brute force, just timing and placement
worked through midwicket with a straight bat
short ball, over off stump, 89mph and Roy sways out of the line
superb placement from Roy as he drives off the back foot being point, it looks like it might beat third man but there's a good diving save
full outside off, slower ball at 73mph/117kph, driven to deep cover
appeal for a catch down the leg side...then the umpire signals wide. Thought I heard a sound of pad. Yes, it did. Harsh call.
back of a length on off stump, driven into the covers
a rasping pull from Roy as Wahab drops short, sends it in front of square but deep square is able to get around
on off stump, he's forward and defends
works a straight delivery into the leg side
angled down the leg side, another wide
short outside off, cut to deep cover
comes forward and bunts the delivery to long-off
touch shorter, rocks onto the back foot and drives to cover
strangled appeal for lbw as Hales flicks this towards short fine leg...sensible strike-rotation by the pair
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off where Irfan uses his boot stop the ball...well, it is a long way down for him
down the pitch then clips to midwicket
well bowled, some spin there for Malik and it takes an inside edge from Roy which Sarfraz can't gather
strong response as he brings out a powerful sweep from outside off and sends it whistling in front of square
tucked off the pads through square leg
worked into the leg side as he closes the face
full at the stumps, driven down the ground
can't beat the bowler this time
this time Yasir dives to his left to make a good save
finds space down the ground this time
another edge? Hales driving off the back foot, maybe a thin bottom edge. Not sure. Either way, very tough for Sarfraz
driven to the covers
neat footwork then he clips to midwicket
another reverse sweep, gets it down towards third man, good save on the boundary
uses his feet again and then drives superbly inside out over mid-off who is inside the circle. Excellent control
flicked off the stumps behind square
whipped through straight midwicket to the man in the deep
pushed with a straight bat down to long-on
short of a length outside off, Roy aims something expansive over the leg side and doesn't make contact
top shot, more fantastic timing from Roy as he stands tall, holds his shape and drives a short-of-a-length delivery off the back foot wide of mid-off. Very classy
a little fuller, another punchy drives, picks out mid-off this time
round the wicket, outside off, chopped into the ground
cracked again! Pulled off the front foot from outside off well in front of square and a superb way to reach a half-century. Very good innings
fresh air this time, goes for another pull, ball dies off the surface and goes under the bottom edge
round the wicket, a strong sweep as he picks this up from off stump and places it behind square
flicked in the air but doesn't carry to midwicket
width outside off and cut firmly through the covers, wide of the deep sweeper...more excellent placement
takes the pad and trickles to short fine leg
nudged into the square-leg area
pushed down the ground to long-on to raise the hundred stand...super platform for England
short-arm pull through midwicket. Sweetly timed
open-faced glide to third man, another single to the total
in the air, and straight to mid-on! Well struck, but always aerial and didn't get under the ball enough to clear the man. The end of a fine opening stand
onto the front foot, punched to cover
pushed back into the crease this time, but angled across the right-hander and punched off the back foot to cover
nurdles the single to get off the mark and keep the strike
good use of the feet, floating like a butterfly to push firmly into the covers
on the pads, flicked into space at midwicket
on the back foot, drilled into the covers, and they pick off another single
four balls, four singles. if this is a sign of England's new commitment to one-day cricket, it's a good sign
clipped to long-on and Root calls three immediately, top running
crunched uppishly past the bowler, down to long-off. At least a single off every ball and eight off the over
width, and that scuttles past a swishing drive. Hardly got up at all

that one did! A flimsy pull as Wahab hustles one through from round the wicket, and after a vehement appeal and an agonising delay, the umpire gives it out. But it has gone to a review and Hales lives on! It flicked his trouser-leg
on the back foot, eased into the covers with a full flow of the bat
on the back foot again, point picks up
good pace, good defence
squeezed out to point, on the back foot again. Tight stuff
clipped firmly to short midwicket
back of a length, Hales plays it from the pitch but can't impart any power
worked off the pads, and that is Hales' fifty, his third in ODIs, and it's been a fine, solid innings with the promise of plenty to come. He hits a long ball when his dander is up ...
forward and driven back to the bowler
bottom-handed bunt to wide long-on
fended back to the bowler
Root keeps finding the gaps
stands tall in defence and pushes back to the bowler
angled back into the batsman, pushed out to cover
solid bat on ball, out into the off side
slightly back of a length, Root hangs back in his crease and eases a push to mid-on
wider of off stump, and clubbed out to the deep
bottom-handed push into the leg-side, Root keeps ticking along
tucked to midwicket once again, well timed and placed for an easy single
shovelled off the hip, out to the leg-side sweeper
defended off the back foot
on the pads, an easy nurdle to square leg
driven up to long-on
tucked off the toes again, easy pickings
flicked out to the leg-side, very calm accumulation
chiselled into the leg-side from an off-stump line. Good gap-finding, but boundaries currently scarce
worked into the leg-side again. No rush
pushed into the covers
clipped to midwicket, well pounced but a good sharp single.
clipped again to midwicket
flicked off the hip, a squeak of interest as short midwicket dived in vain
more intent, a bottom-handed thump out towards cow corner
more singles action than on Tinder at the moment. This one is swiped left, through midwicket again
battered on the up and into the gap at cow corner, the first four for fifty balls. Power and placement
good stride, thumped into the leg-side. Intentful over
on the back foot, driven to mid-off
clipped to midwicket
flicked fine, sharp work in the deep cuts off the second run. Pakistan have been impressive in the field for one and a half matches so far ...
clipped to midwicket, once again
another flick off the pads
half an appeal as bat and pad end up rather too adjacent. But a single is the result
width, cut out to cover
nibbling from a leg-stump line and defended in front of middle
a big waft, no connection. No slip either, so he might have got away with a thick edge
attempting to run a single through third man, exploiting the lack of slip. But Irfan finds some purchase in the surface and jags the ball away
another one passes the edge. Living a touch dangerously in this over
excellent over, another one beats the bat, this time by hopping over the top of an attempted glide/cut. A momentum-stalling return
worked down to third man
on the pads, flicked out to square leg
outside off, helped down to third man with an open-faced steer. Measured accumulation
on the pads, Irfan has a long way to bend to cut off a single so they scamper through
more expert gap-picking from the boundaryless but briskly accumulating Root
eased to mid-on
on the pads yet again, flicked to midwicket
driven on the up, into the covers
angled defence into the gully, Hales dropped his bat which robbed them of a second run
open-faced steer out to point
nurdled into the leg-side again
clipped out to square leg
thump! No sighters for Hales, just down on one knee and walloped over midwicket to bring up the fifty stand. Good stride, long levers. Bosh
a flat-footed under-edged wipe, and that was technically a chance... it was also a mistimed half-tracker
worked out to midwicket again
flicked to leg
bang, and that's another one! Not much more than a golf-swing down the ground, a seven-iron maybe, and it plops over the rope, just out of reach of the fielder
very solidly forward in defence
offspin, on a good length, attecking the stumps and defended cautiously
tossed up, attempted sweep, big appeal but that pitched just outside the line, I think. But the bowler has reviewed it nonetheless. A bit of a waste that
eased up to mid-on
worked into the off side, a rarity today
on the pads, swiped left again, so to speak
down on one knee, a comfortable sweep for another single
thumped into the covers, a good stop
well timed drive to long-off
tucked off the toes, a bit of an awkward tumble from Wahab who seems to have turned his ankle in the process, but he's staying out there, the hard nut
big stride again, defended
back foot push out to cover
beautiful placement, that one skidded on outside off stump and he just helped it behind point, a long chase towards the rope
forward and defended
chipped firmly into the gap behind midwicket
up onto the toes, driven into the covers
flicked firmly out to midwicket, skiddy but skidding straight onto the bat at the moment
in the air and dropped! Wahab, who has been labouring with a sore ankle, is taken by surprise by a reverse dab, in the air, and through his hands at short cover!
a more measured single takes hales deeper into the nineties
touch short, whipped off the back foot through midwicket and Wahab is able to keep them to a single at long-on
flicked along the ground to deep midwicket
worked off the pads again into the leg side
driven down the ground to long-off
comfortably working Yasir around as this one runs through the leg side again
goes over the top this time, and the tip-tap of singles Root goes for a type of slog-sweep but actually sends it very straight over mid-on. That's his first boundary
round the wicket, worked to the leg side, the bowler dives across
flicked in the air! But just wide of a diving midwicket, where Rizwan is
eased down the ground
quicker and flatter at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
pushed square through the leg side, for a moment Hales wanted a second but it wasn't on
moves outside leg stump and drives this straight to long-off
short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot and finds point
fuller this time, Root chases it with a slashing square cut and doesn't make contact
keeps a little low outside off, Root playing off the back foot and gets a thick edge to third man
round the wicket, on a length outside off, opens the face down to third man
he frees his arms at some width outside off, the square drive races to the cover sweeper
tight on off stump, defended calmly to the covers
excellent work by Rizwan at midwicket to keep Root on strike as he pulls a shorter delivery that doesn't quite get up
a reverse sweep towards short third man
this one really dies off the surface and Hales can only find cover
another dot ball as he stays on 98, punches to midwicket
this is good stuff from Iftikhar as he can only find midwicket again
and there it is! Paddle sweeps from outside leg stump, gets it past short fine leg and that's a maiden ODI hundred, off 111 balls. A very significant moment for Hales and he takes in the applause
over the wicket, 91mph, on off stump and defended to point
short of a length, pulled through square leg without much timing
dragged from outside off and pulled to midwicket
slower ball full outside off, jabbed square into the off side...that brings up the hundred stand
opens the face and runs down to third man
slashes off a thick outside edge, one bounce down to third man
dragged down short, the ball is dipping as it reaches Hales it was bowled so slowly, Hales swings it to deep square
very nice placement by Root, gives himself a touch of room then opens the face to slice it between short third man and backward point
tucked off the pads to deep square
that's high and handsome! Hales takes a couple of strides down the pitch and hoists this well over long on for his third six
and he's gone now! Goes for a slog sweep, plays over the top of the ball, his back foot is out of the crease, good take from Sarfraz and a neat stumping
drives his first ball carefully to cover
very smart from Root, scoops Anwar's first ball back into the attack over short fine leg to reach his fifty
full outside off, steered down to third man
full and straight, nice piece of timing as he punches it straight of mid-off to open his account
comes down the pitch, Anwar might have seen him coming and drags the length back, Morgan opens the face to third man and spots it's Irfan
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
worked off around leg stump, behind square, and that's another brace for Morgan
driven off the back foot through the covers
skids on into Morgan who has to jab down quite quickly to keep it out
flicked from outside off down to long-on where Azam is able to keep it to a single
driven to cover
onto the back foot and whipped off his pads to deep midwicket
played back to the bowler
driven off the back foot to deep cover
gets enough on this to clear deep midwicket, he came down the pitch but wasn't to the pitch yet just went through with the shot
now he skips back into his crease and pulls to deep midwicket
driven down to long off
pushed outside off, cut into the covers, can't beat the inner circle
plays this very late, almost off the stumps, but guides it straight to short third man
well bowled, full and straight, jabbed into the off side
slashed away from outside off, down to third man
pushed from off stump down the ground
takes a bottom edge down to third man
top yorker, Morgan can do no more than drill it back to Irfan
low full toss, gets a thick outside edge and Sarfraz makes an excellent one-handed stop diving to his left...good comeback over
guided down to third man
a fast full toss at the stumps, 91mph, and Morgan shovels it to midwicket...think he's broken his bat

it's all happening! Nearly a run out as Morgan digs out a terrific yorker, Wahab gets across in his follow through, switches the ball to his strong hand and throws at the stumps. Morgan well out with a hit but gets a single in the end
he'd have been run out again! Root drove to mid-off, Morgan was sprinting off, got sent back and was not in the picture but the throw misses and neither was the bowler back at the stumps in time
drags a length ball into midwicket...like a pinball machine out there at the moment, throws coming from everywhere
gives himself room, drives a full ball but can't beat mid-off
goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge to short fine leg
perhaps trying to over hit here, Root loses his shape a touch as he tries to heave a length delivery and can't beat Irfan
beaten this time outside off as he has a swing and a miss
a length delivery is clothed into the leg side
full at leg stump, squirted towards fine leg in rather ungainly fashion
gets this one away, a straight, low full toss which Morgan is able to crunch over midwicket...lands just inside the rope. Welcome boundary for England
full outside off, Root giving himself room and can't make contact
and the pressure tells! Wahab deserves that. Root has a swing across the line and leg stump gets hit
lovely bowling, beats Buttler's outside edge...sign of reverse swing
driven through the off side to deep cover
another one past the outside edge, wide outside off at 92mph, Morgan tries to slice it away
driven in the air but drops short of mid-off...just a single off the over. Outstanding from Wahab
that's a clean strike, stays in his crease and lofts a full delivery over mid-off
now he tries the scoop! Had seen short fine-leg come up. But he's beaten outside off
short of a length outside off, clubbed into the covers without any timing, came off the bottom edge
gives himself room outside leg but it's another pinpoint yorker which he can only drive to mid-off
full and straight, opens the face and slices the drive square through the off side wide of the sweepr
a sweetly struck square drive but Rizwan at backward point ensures it's just a single
tight to the body around leg stump, pushed to mid-off
dabbed into the backward point area

could have been a run out at both ends! Buttler pushed the ball towards Wahab who dived in his follow through. The batsmen were in the middle of the pitch. He threw at the non-striker's end and missed, while Morgan then dived to make his ground
swung into the leg side
he has another! Pakistan's superb finish continues. Buttler is bowled off the pads as he gives himself some room outside leg stump. A slower delivery this time
beats the outside edge! This reverses past Taylor as he shuffles across the crease. Ends a magnificent spell from Wahab
clubbed from outside off down to long on
width outside off, slapped into the covers
another slower ball, Morgan can only swing into for a single to deep midwicket
driven into the off side, there's a direct hit from cover but Taylor is safe
finds deep midwicket...Morgan trying to clear the leg side, gets too far underneath the delivery so gets more height than distance and lands comfortably in the lap of Azam
clipped into the leg side but just five off that over
slower ball outside off, it's quite wide but Taylor has moved a long way across so it's not called wide
excellent, again, as he sends down a slower short ball that completely defeats Taylor's pull...takes the body
full outside off, driven down to long off
full and straight, swung into the leg side, only one to deep midwicket
another slower ball which is paddled to short fine leg
finishes with a boundary as Anwar slips in a full toss at the pads, swung away to fine leg by Taylor

inn2.comm: early signs of swing, worked to the leg side
Ideal line, angling into the stumps from the left-arm line
clipped off the pads, out to midwicket
big stride, forward defence. Classical
less classical this time, riding his bat Happy Gilmore-style, but defended down the wicket all the same
huge appeal as Willey straightens one into the pads but there was a huge stride down the wicket beforehand. No review but encouraging signs for England
outside off, a fraction too short and helped through the covers off the back foot, using the natural angle across the right-hander
turned into the leg-side, slightly squared up in defence
very full, flicked off the pads to fine leg
big stride, attempting to negate the swing, for there is a hint
crunched into the covers
good tight over
scher-wing! Curly-wurly inducker, bending back into the right-hander's pads. That won't be reviewed. Off he goes!
swing again, but too leg-sided this time. Optimistic appeal
forward and blocked to mid-on
driven down the ground, well fielded with a slide at mid-on
clipped to the leg side
up onto the toes, fenced into the point region. Another good over from Willey. One of only six left-arm seamers to take a wicket for England in ODIs. SIX!
up onto the toes, flogged down to third man
solidly into line
down the leg side, the swing takes control as Topley loses control
outside off, better line, climbing through to the keeper
on the pads, big appeal, even greater optimism
pushed into the covers
forward once again, and picked up by the bowler
watchful against the swing
forward tentatively and pushed to cover
angled defence out to midwicket

movement, edged, a thin snick through to Buttler who gathers well and low, and the big fish has been landed! Hafeez, Pakistan's form batsman, is gone for a duck to one that just grazed past his tentative defence
well left first-up. Keeping low outside off stump
outside off, left alone. England are bossing this contest right now ...
wide, surely? No? I've seen those given in Tests ...
tighter line, no run this time either
perfect line for the left-armer, cramping the right-hander for room, demanding a leave
driven without conviction to cover
a measured push to the right of mid-off, half a sliding stop but they run for the deflection
thumped into the covers with a pleasing tock of willow, but straight to the fielder
driven into the covers again
forward and pushed into the covers
stands tall in defence, worked to mid-on
outside off, tight line, left alone. It's a strangely soporific passage of play
deep in the crease, defending with a vertical blade
outside off, probing length, but a chastened Pakistan line-up aren't even tempted to be aggressive against this pair at the moment. Woakes and the spinners on the other hand ...
open-faced glide down to third man
back of a length, no width on offer, driven to mid-off
crashing cut, a fraction too wide, but Taylor at point snaffles with a full-length dive (which, admittedly, isn't a lot of length)
squared up a touch on leg stump, defended
too wide, flogged through point on the up, and this time Taylor has no chance to cut it off
pushed back in the crease, up on the toes, defended
thumped into the deep, Topley is the cover sweeper
full length, attacking the pads, defended
short, pulled, not remotely middled, but dribbles into the leg side
forward and defended to cover
very full, a hint of lateral movement, calmly pushed to mid-on
on the pads, curling further leg-side, but worked back down the track
outside off, this one holds its line as a wafty flat-footed drive catches nothing but thin air
smashed into the covers, a fine one-handed pick-up and very nearly a run-out! A direct hit would have been very tight
defended back down the track
tight and probing, nothing for the batsman to do but bide his time
driven up to mid-on but that's a maiden.
a watchful start from bowler and batsman
slower ball, tight to the stumps, defended to mid-on
advancing down the track, the first sign of aggression, but Woakes saw him coming and followed him
driven, and threaded supremely through wide mid-on. A fraction too tight to the leg side from a full length, and a full face of the bat met that one
on the pads and flicked out to square leg
short, swiped, but that pull shot comes off the splice as if socked at with a wet welly, and mid-on completes a simple diving catch to put the skids under Pakistan's sttempts at a recovery
tossed onto a good length, defended
slightly leg-sided,  clipped square
full length, turning away, punched off the back foot to cover
poked into the covers again
decent stride, patted back to the bowler
thumped out to the deep, but the field is well spread and few gaps on offer
short and splice-rattling, worked into the leg-side, a touch uncomfortably
fuller length, defended on the front foot
hustled defence, attacking the stumps again
tight line, watchful defence
wider on the crease, attacking the stumps, pushed up to the bowler
a single into the covers
forward and defended
swished into the covers

shorter, flatter, almost flipper-esque from Rashid! It looked like a horrid long-hop but it scuttled through, and after a long deliberation, the finger goes up, very reluctantly! But they are reviewing... it could have been missing leg ... and it surely was!
full-length, and pushed into the leg-side
on the pads, worked off the back foot to square leg
driven on the up to point
full, straining for non-existent swing, pushed calmly to mid-on
dabbed down to third man
turned off the toes to fine leg
up onto the toes, dabbed down to third man, and they give away a single with an unnecssary shy at the stumps that deflects into no-man's land
a pre-meditated gallop down the pitch and a hopped nurdle to third man, attempted leg glance but it clips the knee-roll and beats the keeper
another single to the cause
solid stride forward
back and across, clipped to midwicket
nurdled from off to leg, but can't beat the fielder
swept, from outside off, into space behind square
tossed up, driven to cover
a firmer drive this time, but well intercepted
slightly short, short-arm-pulled out to midwicket
whisked off the hip from back of a length
worked into the leg-side again
into the leg side again
short, pulled, Taylor grabs at midwicket! A horrid wellied pull, right off the splice, no timing or placement and England have got their eyes on the series-levelling prize
full on off stump, driven to long off
goes down early for a neat paddle sweep, gets it through short fine leg
very full, drilled to cover
comes forward to drive, plays it into the pitch and back to the bowler
big spin outside off, started wide and called wide
nicely bowled! That's a good leg-break, draws him forward and beats the outside edge with some spin
beaten again! This time it's a slightly shorter delivery and he's trying to play off the back foot, the ball skids on
driven carefully to mid-off
after the drought for Woakes comes the flood! Azhar drags on as he chases a delivery with a hint of width. It's an off-cutter which takes the bottom edge
short outside off, loops over the top edge as Sarfraz tries to upper cut to third man
full at off stump, driven to cover
back of a length, 86mph/139kph, defended
full outside off, he opens the face down to third man
pushed out to deep cover
nicely bowled, full at middle, played into the off side
swept from outside off to deep backward square
full, driven to deep cover
there's a googly, deflects off the pads into the leg side
tossed up, more air this time, comes forward and drives through the off side
walks into a solid forward push which beats the cover ring and is wide of the sweeper
nips back a touch from outside off and is defended
a short delivery and it's a lesser-spotted boundary, quickly onto with a pull behind square which bisects the two men out
full and straight again, clipped to mid-on
low full toss, clipped through midwicket but only costs a single
driven to deep cover
swept from around off stump, a very full delivery, to deep square
opens the face to a full ball outside off and finds short third man
big appeal for lbw! It's another googly. Given not out and Rashid has persuaded Morgan to review it. Might be spinning too much. And it's orange on clipping leg stump. Very tight.
nice bowling, that was another wrong 'un, touch shorter and defended
paddled from outside off behind square on the leg side
full and straight, forced through straight midwicket
pushed into midwicket
low full toss which is pushed down the ground
full outside off, pushed to the covers
straight delivery which is nudged to leg
comes forward, pushed into the point region
uses his feet but can only find cover...Moeen races through his first over
goes deep in the crease and drives to mid-on
sweeps again, from outside off, between deep midwicket and deep square
more flight, full on the stumps, driven to cover
a little shorter, it's a googly, but he picks out backward point
drives back to the bowler
defended from middle and leg, runs into the leg side and they can nab a quick single
full and straight, driven to midwicket
played straighter this time and finds space down the ground
starts a little wider, hint of turn, pushed to cover
appeal for lbw appeal as he goes for a sweep, seemed to be heading leg side
a touch quicker and flatter, pushed to midwicket
drives to point
another lbw shout, full on leg stump, probably pitched outside
defended from middle and leg
brings out the sweep and gets it behind square but England won't worry about singles
paddles a low full toss through fine leg, deep square is able to scoot around the boundary rope
cuts and misses
plays with the spin through midwicket
down the pitch, nearly yorks himself, drills the ball back to Moeen
swept away very fine, more work in the deep for Topley who sprints around and then slides
pushed into midwicket and can't find a gap
full outside off, driven to cover inside the circle
full and straight, can't beat midwicket, the pressure keeps building on Pakistan
goes back in the crease and punches down the ground
pushed into the covers
on leg stump, tapped away
it had to come, really. The innings was going nowhere. He goes back to try and play through the off side, skids on, gets a bottom edge into the stumps. Deserved reward for Rashid
very full, dug out back to the bowler
comes forward, drives into the covers, was an easy single but Sarfraz didn't want it. Nearly a run out
flicked to square leg
pushed down the ground
leaves this alone as it spins towards leg stump, deflects off the pad
leading edge into the off side as he aims to leg, but it lands short of cover
manages to beat the bowler and cover with a drive down the ground
that's a very firmly struck sweep and it's placed perfectly in the gap at deep square
appeal for lbw, looks pretty good as it straightens, but given not out
played into the leg side
pushed gently into the covers
dragged down short and slow outside off, but he finds cover
some good spin there for Rashid, Sarfraz opens the face and plays to cover
that beats everything...the edge and the keeper as he goes through Buttler's legs for some byes
flicked through the leg side
driven from outside off down the ground
tickled behind square...pad, I think
played to the leg side, Moeen gets across and fields himself
tucked through square leg
a bottom edge goes past the stumps, some significant spin for Moeen, aiming to force it off the back foot
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to deep cover
glanced down to long leg
angled into the pads again, deflected to long leg
fuller, coming in with the angle, takes an inside edge behind square
full at middle and off, dug out into the covers
slower ball, some width outside off, driven to deep cover
round the wicket, worked into the leg side
off the pads out to deep midwicket
leading edge into the off side aiming for midwicket but it falls safely
flicked off the toes to deep midwicket
deep into the crease and then nudges to the on side
touch shorter, he goes back and drives but picks out cover
full outside off, a slower ball, guided to backward point
clubbed from off stump to mid on
worked off the pads to long leg
another slower one, full outside off, dabbed into the covers
driven sweetly through the covers, nicely onto the front foot, placed wide of the sweeper
opens the face and runs it down to third man
down the track, battered hard and flat over midwicket. That's the way to do it
into position for the sweep, doesn't make contact but Buttler is nutmegged outside the off stump
up onto the toes to defend
crunched into the covers, up on the toes, flashed from way outside leg
round the wicket, onto a good length, worked back to the bowler
slower ball, outside off, bunny-hops through to the keeper with a waft of the bat to send it on its way
up to the toes, punched to mid-on, a wild shy comes in
on a good length once again
slower ball, nibbles back in from outside off, nudged down to third man
outside off, fenced out to third man
cunning variations, tight line, impressive work from young Master Topley
slapped, that was an attempted drive but it's a fat edge down to third man
on the toes, clipped to midwicket
speared down the leg-side
gave himself masses of room and almost couldn't reach his defensive wipe off off stump
punted out to cow corner, picked up on the bounce. It's very flat out there
manipulated out to midwicket
attempted hoick over midwicket, but the intent couldn't match the leg-side line
very tight on leg stump. Too tight
on the pads, worked out to square leg
pushed back onto the stumps, defended into the covers
too wide from Willey and Buttler's glove saves a deflected four
forward and blocked back down the track
cut into the covers, Willey pulls his length back as the batsman advances
more sound than fury there as a wild leg-side wipe dribbles for a single
defended into the leg side
nurdled to leg
battered, hard and flat, over long-on! That's the way to keep the hopes alive!
pushed into the off side
smashed into the leg-side once again, but this time it isn't properly timed, a low full toss, and Woakes steadies himself under the lights to extract the obdurate Anwar!
flicked into the leg-side, another over ticked off
on the pads, worked into the leg-side, Sarfraz continues his lone hand
teased down to third man
forward and defended
slower ball, Wahab waits and waits and tickles it into the covers
slapped up and over the covers, a fraction of room to swing the arms
low full toss, bunted into the leg side
a smothered appeal, sliding down leg
attempted sweep, out to the leg side
down the track, attempted wipe out to midwicket. It's a successful wipe, insofar as it gets there ... but not especially quickly ...
defended on the back foot, into the covers
big stride forward, slapped into the covers, that is a well-earned fifty for Sarfraz, who has been the difference between defeat and humiliation this evening
short and attempted pull out to midwicket
clunked through midwicket, finds the gap and this time there's no cutting it off
short, and spanked out to midwicket but the sweeper is in place to gather this one
a wipe across the line, a spiralling top-edge, a simple plop of a catch for Buttler
blocked out to square leg
angled across the right-hander, slapped into the covers
forward and driven to mid-off
slower ball, just held back a click, on a good off-stump line. A direct hit would have been out as the single is stolen
yorker, very full, outside off, through to the keeper
battered, hard into the covers. Hales intercepts the boundary
sweet timing, a beautiful square drive. A less beautiful full-length dive to make his ground as he comes back for two
thumped out to deep cover again. He's timing it well and seeing it even better
attempted sweep, struck outside the line
round the wicket, another attempted sweep thumps into the front pad. Well outside off stump
slower ball, a lot of them about. Wiped out to mid-on
nothing doing there
full toss, walloped on the up and clean through the covers. That will keep the embers glowing!
outside off, dabbed down to third man
attractively eased out to square leg for another notch on the scoreboard. Holding the flourish on that leg glance
forward, pushed to cover, Sarfraz is already halfway down so why not make it a run?
tidy drive, but straight to the fielder
short and through to the keeper
slower-ball bouncer, pulled round the corner without much timing
lovely line, a cutter, nipping back in as Sarfraz attempts a back-foot drive but is cramped for room by the grip off the surface, and Buttler tidies up
there's six of them! Slower ball, too short, Yasir was anchored on the back foot and that has travelled way over midwicket!
another big wind-up, but no contact this time, other than ball on thigh pad
flat-batted into the leg-side again
thumped into the leg side
yorker! That's the way to bring down skyscrapers, denotate them at the foundations ... Irfan's timbers tumble, and it's 1-1 with two to play!
